Alternative 'No-box' Check Box Style

Traditionally, check boxes are check marks that appear inside a box. Hence the name. However more modern styling has been used that does not include the box part of the check box. The styling on the 'no-box' check boxes applies just to the check mark itself, and relies on surrounding context to provide additional visual cues (such as hover background color changes).

No-check check boxes can be used in tables to prevent them from being too busy visually, and in drop-down lists if the real estate is limited.

Styling for this type of check box has not been finalized.
